author: Tobias Grey
title: France Finally Fetes America’s Mary Cassatt
text:
Something happened on the road to acclaim for Mary Cassatt. As the only American artist to exhibit in Paris with the French impressionists, a close friend of some of them and a popular artist, she should have been a shoo-in for fame on both sides of the Atlantic. But while American museums have staged numerous Cassatt retrospectives, French museums—still key judges of art’s winners and losers—had never organized a single one.
Until now. It’s taken the small Musée Jacquemart-André in Paris to reintroduce Cassatt to a French... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
